definitions.definition: without human warmth; not friendly and without features that make people feel interested or involved:
examples: She has a very cold and impersonal manner.

definitions.definition: not referring to people or a particular person by name:
examples: He always tried to keep the discussions impersonal so that no one would be offended.

definitions.definition: An impersonal verb or sentence has the subject "it" and does not refer to a particular person or thing, as in the sentence It's cold outside.

examples: Some religions favour the idea of an impersonal god.
